title: simlife_for_windows.zip
description:
SimLife is a computer game produced by Maxis in 1992. The concept of the game is to simulate an ecosystem; players may modify the genetics of the plants and animals that inhabit the virtual world. The point of this game is to experiment and create a self sustaining ecosystem.
Simlife screenshot from the Apple Macintosh Version.
Simlife screenshot from the Apple Macintosh Version.

The producers of SimLife refer to it as "The Genetic Playground". The game allows users to explore the interaction of life-forms and environments. Users can manipulate the genetics of both plants and animals to determine whether these new species could survive in the Earth&#039;s various environments. Players can also create new worlds with distinctive environments to see how certain species (earth&#039;s species or their own) fare within them. Simlife has been used by some homeschooling groups as a evolution curriculum enhancer.
just unpack it and run Install.
